1FN.F.summary: Fnac Darty SA engages in retail of entertainment and leisure products, consumer electronics, and domestic appliances in France, Switzerland, Iberian Peninsula, Belgium, and Luxembourg. The company offers consumer electronics, including desktop computers, laptops, tablets, software, printers, e-readers, telephones and office products, and accessories, as well as various connected products; cameras and photography accessories; televisions and video accessories, such as DVD players, Blu-Ray players, and other accessories; and audio items and accessories comprising MP3 players, headphones, docking stations, and related accessories. It also provides editorial products that include hard copy and digital books; discs comprising music CDs and video DVDs, and Blu-Ray discs; video games and gaming consoles; and gadgets, T-shirts, musical instruments, and others. In addition, the company offers domestic appliances, which comprise refrigerators/freezers, cooking equipment, dishwashers, and washing machines/dryers; and vacuum cleaners, food processors, and body care and water/air treatment appliances, as well as other products and services, including kitchen units, home and design products, games and toys, urban mobility, stationery, wellbeing, and food and beverage products. Further, it provides warranty extension, product insurance sale, repair-related subscription sale, after-sale, and delivery and installation services; rental services for consumer electronics and delivery services; ticketing and gift boxes; and membership cards for the company's loyalty programs. As of December 31, 2020, the company had a total of 908 stores, including 344 franchises. The company was formerly known as Groupe Fnac sociÃ©tÃ© anonyme. Fnac Darty SA was founded in 1954 and is headquartered in Ivry-sur-Seine, France.

2JV1.F.summary: Emova Group SA operates as a retail flower distribution company. It operates a network of 29 own shops and 367 franchise stores under the Monceau Fleurs, Rapid 'Flore, Happy, and Au Nom de la Rose brands primarily in France. The company also offers indoor and outdoor decorative plants. The company was formerly known as Groupe Monceau Fleurs S.A. and changed its name to Emova Group SA in April 2015. The company was founded in 1965 and is based in Boulogne Billancourt, France. Emova Group SA is a subsidiary of Emova Holding.

6CE.SG.short_name: Groupe LDLC S.A. Actions au Por
6CE.SG.summary: Groupe LDLC sociÃ©tÃ© anonyme engages in the online distribution of multimedia and computer hardware products in Europe. The company offers data processing products, such as PC memory and cases, laptops, PC screens and mouse, motherboards, bags, satchels, PC keyboards, switches, desktop PCs, headsets, case fans, NAS servers, and PC power supply products. It also provides helmets, docks, Bluetooth and hi-fi speakers, video projectors, hi-fi sets, TV wall mounts, TVs, camera tripods and lenses, bags and photo cases, home theater systems, hi-fi systems and amplifiers, digital cameras, and turntables; and phone cases and battries, mobiles and smartphones, iPhone accessories, phone protective films and chargers, cordless phones, cables and adapters, auto speakers, pedestrian and helmet kits, smartphone accessories, wired phones, cars, and headsets. In addition, the company offers PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PS3, and Xbox 360 accessories; goodies, joypads, joysticks, and PC steering wheels; and PS4, Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, and PC games, as well as retrogaming products. Further, it provides products connected with bracelets, accessories, sensors, surveillance cameras, weather channels, drones, Apple HomeKit accessories, video recordings, multifunction centrals, Segway, alarm kits, watches, bulbs, and scales. The company also offers printer cartridges and toners, felt and marker pens, 3D filaments, shirts, notebooks, batteries and chargers, adhesive tapes and glues, binders, printer papers, stamps, staplers, perforators, calculators, and furniture and furnishings; and USBs, HDMIs, display ports, VGAs, DVIs, serial ATAs, cable passes, connectors, series, and strips. It operates through 11 sites and 30 owned or franchised LDLC.com stores; and serves individuals and professionals. The company was formerly known as LDLC.com SA and changed its name to Groupe LDLC sociÃ©tÃ© anonyme in October 2016. The company was founded in 1996 and is based in Limonest, France.

6JF.F.summary: Passat SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme engages in the image-assisted sale of consumer products in France. The company sell housekeeping, cooking, DIY, garden, beauty, leisure and fitness, and cleaning products. Passat SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme was founded in 1987 and is headquartered in Fourqueux, France.

The company was founded in 1965 and is based in Boulogne Billancourt, France. Emova Group SA is a subsidiary of Emova Holding.

ALHRS.PA.summary: Hydrogen-Refueling-Solutions SA manufactures hydrogen refueling stations for all types of vehicles, light and heavy fleets, for the mobility, industrial activities, storage, and energy markets. The company was incorporated in 2004 and is based in Champ-sur-Drac, France.

ALUPG.PA.summary: UPERGY SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme distributes batteries in France and internationally. The company offers lighting products, industrial packs, rechargeable lead batteries, PMR batteries and chargers, and solar batteries. It provides its products under the Allbatteries, 1001 BATTERY BATTERIES, and Microbatt brands. UPERGY SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme distributes its products to professionals, individuals, small retailers, large groups, and wholesalers. The company was formerly known as VDI Group SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme and changed its name to UPERGY SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme in June 2018. The company was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in Champagne-au-Mont-d'Or, France. UPERGY SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme is a subsidiary of BDR SAS.

ALVIA.PA.summary: Viapresse SA provides online subscription services. Its products include magazines, newspapers, periodicals, professional, and trade journals. The company offers student magazines, digital magazines, living well magazines, cultural magazines, sport magazines, women and men's magazines, children magazines, adult magazines, and professional magazines. Viapresse SA was incorporated in 1998 and is based in Paris, France.

CAFO.PA.long_name: Centrale d'Achat Française pour l'Outre-Mer Société Anonyme
CAFO.PA.summary: Centrale d'Achat FranÃ§aise pour l'Outre-Mer SociÃ©tÃ© Anonyme provides home improvement products. The company operates 23 stores that offers household electrical products, household equipment, musical instruments, and sound equipment in the West Indies, Guyana, Reunion Island, and New Caledonia. It also operates Vente-Unique.com that engages in the online sale of furniture for individuals; and DirectLowCost.com that supplies furniture and decoration products for distribution professionals. The company was founded in 1985 and is based in Paris, France.

MLTRO.PA.summary: TROC DE L'ILE SA sells second-hand articles through its troc.com Website. The company offers furnishings for bedrooms, dining rooms, sitting rooms, offices, kitchens, and bathrooms, as well as storage, garden, business, and occasional furniture; and decorative items, which include table arts, collections, clock and watch-making-measuring instruments, pictures, sculptures, knickknacks-decorative objects, mirrors, other decoration items, costume jewelry and accessories, carpets, and light fittings. It also provides electrical goods, including large and small electrical goods, heating products, and air conditioning units; do-it-yourself products that include tools, ironmongery-taps, joinery, home security automation products, materials, garden and swimming pool equipment, and pet products; and leisure products, such as weight training products, cycles and rollers, mountain and water sports products, racquet and other sports equipment, camping products, vehicle equipment, leather goods, and team sports products. In addition, the company offers child welfare products consisting of equipment for outings, car seats, toys, furniture, safety products, and baby health food; video and audio products, including HIFI and sound products, car electronics, video and photo products, and optical products; multi-media products, such as telephones, information technology products, games, consoles, software products, and video games; and products related to culture, including DVD CD records, books, games, and musical instruments. TROC DE L'ILE SA is based in Les Angles, France. As of March 26, 2019, TROC DE L'ILE SA operates as a subsidiary of Happy Cash SAS.
